Posts.Content: Hi Pam, I too am in the same position as you. I'm 38 years old, finished up my treatments in Dec. I recently saw my onco and she wants me to either start ovarian suppression injections once a month for 5 years or have my ovaries removed. I'm on tamoxifin, it's not stopping my menstrual cycle, but neither did the chemo liked she had hoped. I was Er/pr+. I haven't decided which route to take, I'm leaning towards having the ovaries removed. Take care, Sue
Posts.Signature: Age 38 dx-6/04, Stage I, grade 3 1.9cm, invasive ductal ca lumpectomy-rt breast negative nodes ER/PR +,Her2+ 4 A/C, 35 rad Tamoxifin, 5 yrs
Posts.Title: having ovaries removed after breast cancer treatment?

Posts.Content: Hello Ladies, My name is Sue, I am 38 years old and live in Illinois. I was diagnosed 6/o4 with a 1.9cm, grade 3, invasive ductal ca. Lumpectomy w/negative nodes. I had 4 rounds of chemo and 35 radiation treatments. I started tamoxifin 2 months ago. My question is does this black cloud that follows me everywhere ever go away. I just can't get the feeling out of my head that there's more cancer in my body. Are these normal feelings? I see my onc. tomorrow. Hopefully she can put my mind at ease. Thanks for listening! Sue
Posts.Signature: Age 38 dx-6/04, Stage I, grade 3 1.9cm, invasive ductal ca lumpectomy-rt breast negative nodes ER/PR +,Her2+ 4 A/C, 35 rad Tamoxifin, 5 yrs
Posts.Title: New member

Posts.Content: Thanks for the advice. I did talk with my oncologist about the procedure and she thought it was fine. She'd tell me point blanke if she thought there was a concern. I'm taking effexer for hot flashes, but it doesn't seem to help any. I just switched about a month ago from celexa to the effexer and I haven't noticed much of a change. I'm having trouble sleeping, and I don't want to take sleeping pills. I'm going to have a consultation first and see what he has to say. If there's any doubt in my mind, I certainly won't go through with it. I've bee through enough!! Again, thanks for your input. I'll keep you posted!! Sue
Posts.Signature: Age 38 dx-6/04, Stage I, grade 3 1.9cm, invasive ductal ca lumpectomy-rt breast negative nodes ER/PR +,Her2+ 4 A/C, 35 rad Tamoxifin, 5 yrs
Posts.Title: So long Hot Flashes!

Posts.Content: Hello eveyone, I am 39 years old, and was put into medical menopause. I receive lupron injections once a month. I am experiencing horrible hot flashes, my face turns so red, sometimes it scares me. A friend of mine recently had a procedure done to get rid of her hot flashes, and it worked!! It's called a STELLATE GANGLION BLOCK. It's an injection you get in your neck(OUCH) and it's supposed to block signals that can cause hot flashes from reaching to your brain. They say it can work up to six months without a hot flash. The only real side effects is a bloodshot eye or droopy eye, sometimes a hoarse voice. It disappears in 3-6 hours. Needless to say, I singed up. It's a study the doctor is conducting. The gal who had it done sleeps better, her mood is much better and those dreaded hot flashes are gone. Has anyone heard of this procedure. Any input would be greatly appreciated. I'm having the procedure on July 6th. I am so ready to be hot-flash free!!! Thanks for listening!!! Hugs, Sue
Posts.Signature: Age 38 dx-6/04, Stage I, grade 3 1.9cm, invasive ductal ca lumpectomy-rt breast negative nodes ER/PR +,Her2+ 4 A/C, 35 rad Tamoxifin, 5 yrs
Posts.Title: So long Hot Flashes!

Posts.Content: Hi Laurajean, Welcome... I had my lumpectomy last June. It wasn't so bad. Like DIO, I took pain killers for a day then tylennol thereafter. They put a drain tube in, it looked like a grenade(sp). I had to carry it in my bra for 3 days. For me it was more emotional pain than physical. I had 7 weeks of radiation, a bad sunburn and very tired but compared to chemo it was a breeze. Just a pain in the butt to have to drive to the Hospital five days a week. Have you had the lymph nodes checked out yet.Like you I'm pre-menapausal. Im currently receiving Lupron injections to stop my periods. Are you estrogen positive or negative? I'll be thinking of you on the 28th. Please let us know how everything goes. Keep the faith, your in my prayers!! Hugs, Sue
Posts.Signature: Age 38 dx-6/04, Stage I, grade 3 1.9cm, invasive ductal ca lumpectomy-rt breast negative nodes ER/PR +,Her2+ 4 A/C, 35 rad Tamoxifin, 5 yrs
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, I finished up 4 rounds of chemo on Sept. 21. Shortly thereafter my joints started creaking & cracking so bad, my neck sounds like I'm walking in kitty litter. My onco. says it's from the chemo. Has anyone experienced this, does it go away? Also, I had my nodes removed end of June. Just recently, under my arm has become very sore . I just started walking again, about 3 miles 3-4 times a week. I wasn't sure if that could make it so sore. Is this normal? I go for my first mammogram since my diag next week, I'm a bit scared . My sister was recently diagnosed and they were not able to detect one of her tumors on mamm or ultrasound. Thanks for listening, Hugs Sue
Posts.Signature: Age 38 dx-6/04, Stage I, grade 3 1.9cm, invasive ductal ca lumpectomy-rt breast negative nodes ER/PR +,Her2+ 4 A/C, 35 rad Tamoxifin, 5 yrs
Posts.Title: Oh My Creaking Joints!

Posts.Content: Leo, I had 4 rounds of AC, every 3 weeks. I saw my radiation oncologist on Tuesday and he has ordered a ct scan and a bone scan, because the pain by my breast has gotten worse. He thought it was possibly inflamation from the radiation. My mammogram was fine. Now I just have to get through these next 2 tests, I'm confident all will be fine. Thanks for listening, Sue
Posts.Signature: Age 38 dx-6/04, Stage I, grade 3 1.9cm, invasive ductal ca lumpectomy-rt breast negative nodes ER/PR +,Her2+ 4 A/C, 35 rad Tamoxifin, 5 yrs
Posts.Title: Oh My Creaking Joints!

Posts.Content: Hi Nancy, I decided to hold off on the procedure. The more people I talked to and listened too(including yourself-Thank you!!), I realized this was not for me. My friend who had it done still hasn't had a hot flash and feels great. When I talked to my radiologist he too had never heard of it and was concerned that it would effect my ability to sweat properly, trust me, I sweat alot... He was also concerned that it might make my eyes dry and very uncomfortable. I told him I'd wait till more info was out there. Thanks again for your input. Sleeping is still difficult but I'm healthy and happy, life is wonderful!!! Hugs, Sue
Posts.Signature: Age 38 dx-6/04, Stage I, grade 3 1.9cm, invasive ductal ca lumpectomy-rt breast negative nodes ER/PR +,Her2+ 4 A/C, 35 rad Tamoxifin, 5 yrs
Posts.Title: So long Hot Flashes!

Posts.Content: Marian, Congratulations on your completion of your radiation treatments. What a milestone. I finished up in December, so I know your excitement well! I hope you continue to feel well and best wishes with the chemo. I'm new to this board and it's amazing the support and encouragement you receive from everyone, its so awesome! Take care, Sue

Posts.Title: Radiation Finished

Posts.Content: Hi Jill, I too am going through the same thing right now. I just started Lupron injections once a month to suppress the ovaries. I'm seriously considering having the ovaries removed, like you, I'm scared to death of other cancers occuring. I even inquired about having a full hyst, I'm only 39 so my oncologist doesn't want me to have one, even though I'm done having children. The hot flashes started about two weeks ago, mild so far. Good luck with your decision. Hugs, Sue

Posts.Content: Congratulations Lauri, What fantastic news. I'm coming up on my one year and it's so reassuring to hear such wonderful news. Take care Hugs, Sue

Posts.Title: Celebrating 9 years today....m

Posts.Content: I finished radiation treatments in December. I still have pain, especially by my ribs, on the side of my breast. I had a bone scan and ct scan. They didn't find anything. They thought it was inflamation due to the radiation. Our bio's sound very similiar. I just turned 39, and recently was put into medical menopause. The chemo and tomoxifin wern't doing it, so I get lupron injections in my stomach once a month. I don't know if this helps at all, but I just wanted you to know that your not alone with your concerns. Take care, HUGS!!! Sue
Posts.Signature: Age 38 dx-6/04, Stage I, grade 3 1.9cm, invasive ductal ca lumpectomy-rt breast negative nodes ER/PR +,Her2+ 4 A/C, 35 rad Tamoxifin, 5 yrs
Posts.Title: breast pain

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, On March 9th I had a bone scan, ct scan, rib & chest x-rays for some pain I've been experiencing since radiation. I'm thrilled to report that all came back fine. I received the results on Thursday, on Friday, I booked a luxurious trip to Mexico with my husband. This black cloud that's been hanging around so long is lifting, it's partly sunny now! We leave for Mexico in 3 weeks, I'll post when we return. Thanks for all the support, you guys are the best! Sue
Posts.Signature: Age 38 dx-6/04, Stage I, grade 3 1.9cm, invasive ductal ca lumpectomy-rt breast negative nodes ER/PR +,Her2+ 4 A/C, 35 rad Tamoxifin, 5 yrs
Posts.Title: More Good News!
